result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Buda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.  Court costs and victim witness surcharges.  ALL  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 5/27/2021.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil jdugment.

Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after completion of reconfinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

Successfully complete a parenting program and a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count one.  Straight time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L Buda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.

As to Count 2:
The court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to Count 1, with credit for 0 days time served, straight time.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 6 months with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after completion of re-confinement.

-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 05/27/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 05/27/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Anthony L Buda in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Anthony L Buda in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to negotiations, counts 3 & 4 are dismissed but read in for the purposes of sentencing.

As to Counts 1 & 2:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Anthony L Buda not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Counsel did not have all the paperwork completed at the time the case was to be called and court was starting a motion hearing. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 5/27/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Anthony L Buda not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 4/18/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Anthony L Buda in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Anthony L Buda in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Robinson-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF2668 that are attached to the complaint.State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony L Buda in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Anthony L Buda in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2, 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
